title: Designing Data-Driven Science Learning with Interactive E-Books

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Learners explore interactive e-books using personal smart devices (tablets/smartphones), while instructors monitor progress via real-time analytics dashboards

learning_goals: Learners can interpret interaction patterns with over 80% accuracy using data analytics features in interactive e-books.
Learners can submit improved design proposals for quiz and simulation elements in e-books at least three times to enhance understanding of science content.
Learners can provide two types of personalized feedback based on learning behavior data (dwell time, click frequency, etc.).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
